p: Interaction between the S protein and ACE2 can be used to identify intermediate hosts of SARS-CoV-2, as ACE2 from different species, such as amphibians, birds, and mammals, has a conserved primary structure [ 38]. Luan et al. compared the binding affinities between ACE2 and SARS-CoV-2 S from mammals, birds, snakes, and turtles and found that the ACE2 of Bovidae and Cricetidae interacted well with SARS-CoV-2 S RBD but that ACE2 from snakes and turtles could not.
